intro: Pleurostachys hoehneana, commonly known as the Hoehne's pampa grass, is a rare and endangered plant native to the high-altitude grasslands of South America. It is a member of the Poaceae family, characterized by its tufted growth habit and fibrous root system. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves with a bluish-gray sheen, adapted to the harsh, cold conditions of its habitat. It produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear tiny, wind-pollinated flowers. Due to habitat loss and limited distribution, conservation efforts are crucial for its survival.
